intro: Jonesia pinnata, commonly known as the broadleaf jonesia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are deeply divided into several lobes. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
